answers.answer: I think that you are mixing apples, oranges, and Cheerios.  Some of what you are describing may be mild eczema--people often get irritated-looking patches in places like armpits and the groin from mild eczema, a hereditary condition.  These spots need to be treated not just with moisturizer--the skin is inflamed, not dry--but with a prescription-strength hydrocortisone.  Bruises that come from trauma you can't remember happen all the time.  Your basic problem is anxiety.  None of it sounds like something systemic or sexual.  So what I suggest is that you get a physical exam, to tell you for sure that you don't have diabetes, etc., and that you see a skin doctor, so you'll know what you have, skin-wise, and get what you need to treat it.Best.Dr. Rockoff

question: I seem to be having some skin problems at the age of 32 years and I am male.  I seem to be getting jock itch and diaper rash a number of times over the past few years and I do not play sports at this point in my life.  I also had a mild skin irritation under my armpits and was diagnosed as intertraigo (sp?).  I passed after about a month and a moderate strength hydrocortisone cream.  I am thin as well.  I also get a red patch on the top of my left foot right after the shower but it fades in about 15 minutes.  I treat the jock itch but it takes awhile to clear, more that 2 weeks.  I have also seen a few (2) bruises and do not remember if I did something to bring them on.  I am worried I might have something like diabetes and not know it, or something more serious like HIV and not know it?  I have never engaged in anal sex or drug use but 8 years ago I did have one unprotected encounter with a woman.  Is it possible it is all just a coincidence but it seems like too much stuff at once.   Maybe allergic to my dog?  I use hypoallergenic detergent as well.Thanks for your thoughts!
title: seemingly random skin problems?
